concise_definition: v. 包围, 环绕, 围困

definitions.explanation_en: To be encircled or enclosed on all sides by people, objects, or conditions, often implying a sense of being enclosed or confined.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指被他人、物体或环境从所有方向包围或环绕，常暗示被封闭或限制的状态。
definitions.example_en: The castle was surrounded by a wide moat and high stone walls.
definitions.example_cn: 这座城堡被一条宽阔的护城河和高大的石墙所包围。

definitions.explanation_en: To be enveloped or immersed in a particular atmosphere, emotion, or situation, often used metaphorically.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指被某种氛围、情绪或情境所笼罩或浸染，常用于比喻意义。
definitions.example_en: She was surrounded by love and support during her recovery.
definitions.example_cn: 她在康复期间被爱与支持所包围。

definitions.explanation_en: To be encircled by a group or quantity of something, especially when emphasizing abundance or dominance.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指被大量某物或一群人环绕，尤其强调数量上的压倒性或丰富性。
definitions.example_en: The speaker was surrounded by reporters eager to ask questions.
definitions.example_cn: 这位演讲者被一群急于提问的记者团团围住。

comparison.analysis: “Encircled” (被环形包围) 与 “surrounded” 非常接近，但更强调形成一个完整的圆形或环状包围，常用于军事或地理语境。而 “surrounded” 更通用，可指任何方向的包围，不一定是规则的环形。
“Enveloped” (被包裹) 强调被完全覆盖或包容，常用于抽象概念如情感、雾气或黑暗，带有更柔和、渗透性的意象。而 “surrounded” 更强调外部的包围，主体仍保持相对独立。
“Circled” (被绕行/围成圈) 通常指在周围移动或形成一个圈，但不一定构成封闭或限制。例如飞机在机场上空盘旋。而 “surrounded” 意味着被完全包围，主体无法自由出入。
